org.hps.readout

Class ReadoutDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.readout.ReadoutDriver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DigitizationReadoutDriver, DigitizationWithPulserDataMergingReadoutDriver, GTPClusterReadoutDriver, HodoscopePatternReadoutDriver, HodoscopePlotsDriver, HodoscopePreprocessingDriver, PulserDataReadoutDriver, RawConverterReadoutDriver, SLICDataReadoutDriver, SvtDigitizationWithPulserDataMergingReadoutDriver, SvtPulserReadoutDriver, SVTReadoutDriver, TriggerDriver, TruthReadoutDriver

    public abstract class ReadoutDriver
extends Driver
    Class ReadoutDriver is an abstract framework for defining a driver that functions with the HPS readout simulation. A readout driver is responsible for interfacing with the ReadoutDataManager for both the purpose of creating data output collections, and accessing input data collections. It is also responsible for declaring its own time offsets and collection dependencies. To this end, it must perform several tasks:
    • Declare itself: A readout driver must declare itself to the ReadoutDataManager. This is done by default via the default constructor, but if this is overridden, it then the superclass constructor must be called, or the driver must be manually declared via the method ReadoutDataManager.registerReadoutDriver(ReadoutDriver). Note that if the driver is a trigger driver, it must instead use the method ReadoutDataManager.registerTrigger(TriggerDriver) instead.
    • Declare input collections: All readout drivers must specify which data collections they require as input. This is used to correctly calculate the total time displacement of a driver by the ReadoutDataManager and is accomplished by calling addDependency(String) for each input collection. This should be done in the startOfData() method.
    • Declare time displacement: Readout drivers must specify the amount of simulation time (events) that they need to process their input data before they can produce output from it. For instance, a driver that needs to buffer 16 ns into the "future" to make its decisions would need to specify an offset of 16 ns.
    • Declare output collections: All readout drivers must also declare what collections they produce. This is performed by the method ReadoutDataManager.registerCollection(LcsimCollection) and must be done after all input collections have been declared and the driver time offset calculated. This is also generally performed in the startOfData() method.
    • Produce on-trigger data: Some drivers may need to produce data to write into triggered readout files that is not or can not be stored in the ReadoutDataManager itself. In this case, each driver is allowed to produce its own special collections data via the method getOnTriggerData(double), where the argument is the true trigger time (i.e. the simulation time of the trigger event with a time correction applied based on the time displacements of the driver chain leading up to it). Drivers that require this functionality may override the aforementioned method. This method is only called on a trigger write-out event, and by default will return a value of null. If a driver does not require this functionality, the method may be ignored.
    • Declare special data time displacement: Drivers must also declare the total amount of time that they need to produce their local on-trigger data. If no on-trigger data is produced, this should be set to 0 ns.
    The goal of a readout driver is to be able to obtain needed input data from any collection, regardless of the relative time offsets of those collections, and to output its own collections, without needing to know any information about how the input collections are generated. A driver should only need to know the name of the input collection. This is accomplished by using the above declared information in the ReadoutDataManager to handle time offset alignment between data sets automatically.

    By knowing the what collections a driver needs, and how long it takes to produce its output, the data manager can determine what the "true" data time for each output collection from each driver is. It then allows drivers to request data from within a given "true" time range via the method ReadoutDataManager.getData(double, double, String, Class) without that driver needing to manually sync itself with its dependencies. It is this method that should then be used to obtain data, rather than pulling it from the event stream directly.

    Data is output similarly to the data manager directly. This is done via the method ReadoutDataManager.addData(String, Collection, Class). The needed time correction is then automatically applied.

    A driver should make sure that its input collection is populated to the needed time before requesting the data. This can be done through the method ReadoutDataManager.checkCollectionStatus(String, double) for the appropriate collection.

      • addDependency

        protected void addDependency(String collectionName)
        Specifies that the output of this readout driver depends on the specified input collection.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - - The name of the input collection.

      • isPersistent

        protected boolean isPersistent()
                        throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Indicates whether this collection is persisted into the output LCIO file or not.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the collection is persisted, and false if it is not.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Occurs if a particular implementing driver class does not support persisted readout.

      • getDependencies

        protected Collection<String> getDependencies()
        Returns a Collection of type String containing the names of the input collections used by this driver.
        Returns:
        Returns a collection of String objects representing the driver input collection names.

      • getIDDecoder

        protected IDDecoder getIDDecoder(String collectionName)
                          throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                 UnsupportedOperationException
        Gets the IDDecoder needed to read the cell IDs for the objects produced by the indicated collection. This will result in an exception if the requested collection is not managed by this driver.
        Returns:
        Either returns the ID decoder used by the specified collection.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the requested collection is not managed by this driver.
        UnsupportedOperationException - Occurs if there is no IDDecoder object for the specified collection.

      • getOnTriggerData

        protected Collection<TriggeredLCIOData<?>> getOnTriggerData(double triggerTime)
        Generates a Collection containing any special output data produced by the driver that should be included in triggered output.

        By default, this outputs null. Individual drivers must override the method as needed.
        Parameters:
        triggerTime - - The time at which the trigger occurred.
        Returns:
        Returns a collection containing all special output data.

      • getReadoutWindowAfter

        protected double getReadoutWindowAfter()
                                throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Gets the time window after the trigger time in which objects from this collection will be written into the output file.
        Returns:
        Returns the post-trigger readout window in units of nanoseconds.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Occurs if a particular implementing driver class does not support persisted readout, or does not support custom readout windows.

      • getReadoutWindowBefore

        protected double getReadoutWindowBefore()
                                 throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Gets the time window before the trigger time in which objects from this collection will be written into the output file.
        Returns:
        Returns the pre-trigger readout window in units of nanoseconds.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Occurs if a particular implementing driver class does not support persisted readout, or does not support custom readout windows.

      • getTimeDisplacement

        protected abstract double getTimeDisplacement()
        Specifies the amount of simulation time that the driver needs to produce its output. This indicates that the driver's present output was generated based on input a time equal to (getCurrentTime() - getTimeDisplacement()).
        Returns:
        Returns the time displacement of output data as a double.

      • getTimeNeededForLocalOutput

        protected abstract double getTimeNeededForLocalOutput()
        Specifies the amount of simulation time that the driver needs to produce special on-trigger data.
        Returns:
        Returns the time displacement of output data as a double.

        public void setPersistent(boolean state)
                   throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets whether this data collection should be written to the output LCIO file.
        Parameters:
        state - - true means that the collection is persisted, and false that it is not.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Occurs if a particular implementing driver class does not support persisted readout.

        Parameters:
